SOD.Warning: Be aware, this will clear all Heat/Wanted
SOD.CrewTypeBox: Click to choose a Crew Type
SOD.ChooseOneOrTwoEdges: Choose one or two edges and an equal number of flaws
SOD.AddAdditionalTypeOfGangText:
You can add an additional type to a gang or expert by spending two crew upgrades.
When a cohort performs actions for which its types apply, it uses its full quality rating. Otherwise, its quality is zero. A given cohort can have up to two types. Some crew upgrades will add the “Elite” feature to a gang, which gives them +1d when they roll for a given Type.
SOD.ClassExpClue1: Every time you roll a desperate action, mark xp in that action's attribute.
SOD.ClassExpClue2: You expressed your beliefs, drives, heritage, or background.
SOD.ClassExpClue3: You struggled with issues from your vice or traumas during the session.
SOD.ClassExpClueDescription: At the end of each session, for each item below, mark 1 xp (in your playbook or an attribute) or 2 xp if that item occurred multiple times.
SOD.CrewExpClue1: At the end of each session, for each item below, mark 1 xp (or instead mark 2xp if that item occurred multiple times).
SOD.EdgesFearsomeDescription: The cohort is terrifying in aspect and reputation.
SOD.EdgesIndependentDescription: The cohort can be trusted to make good decisions and act on their own initiative in the absence of direct orders.
SOD.EdgesLoyalDescription: The cohort can't be bribed or turned against you.
SOD.EdgesTenaciousDescription: The cohort won't be deterred from a task.
SOD.FlawsBloodthirstyDescription: The cohort is excessively violent and cruel.
SOD.FlawsGutlessDescription: The cohort is soft-hearted and cowardly.
SOD.FlawsUnreliableDescription: The cohort isn't always available, due to other obligations, stupefaction from their vices, etc.
SOD.FlawsWildDescription: The cohort is drunken, debauched, and loud-mouthed.
SOD.HarmImpairedDescription: The cohort operates with reduced quality (-1d).
SOD.HarmBrokenDescription: The cohort can't do anything until they recover.
SOD.HarmDeadDescription: The cohort is destroyed. You can spend coin equal to your Tier +2 to restore it, plus two downtime activities to recruit new gang members, or hire a new expert.
SOD.RollTokenDescription: If you want to pull the numbers from a character, select their Token first.
SOD.RollPartialSuccessPositionControlled: 성공하지만 가벼운 대가가 따릅니다. 원한다면 대가를 받지 않고 후퇴하여 다른 접근법을 시도할 수 있습니다.
SOD.RollFailurePositionControlled: 실패합니다. You falter. Press on by seizing a risky opportunity, or withdraw and try a different approach.
SOD.RollFailurePositionRisky: Things go badly. You suffer harm, a complication occurs, you end up in a desperate position, you lose this opportunity.
SOD.RollFailurePositionDesperate: It's the worst outcome. You suffer severe harm, a serious complication occurs, you lose this opportunity for action.
SOD.EffectWarning: Managing Active Effects within an Owned Item is not currently supported by FoundryVTT and will be added in a subsequent update.
SOD.Name: Name
SOD.AcquireAssetExtra: To raise the result beyond critical, you may spend 2 coin per +1 Tier bonus.
SOD.RollViceFailure: You overindulge. Clear {clear_stress} stress and choose one of the following consequences:
SOD.RollViceFailureAttactTrouble: Attract Trouble. Select or roll an additional entanglement.
SOD.RollViceFailureLost: Lost. Your character vanishes for a few weeks. Play a different character until this one returns from their bender. When your character returns, they've also healed any harm they had.
SOD.RollViceFailureTapped: Tapped. Your current purveyor cuts you off. Find a new source for your vice.
SOD.RollFortuneCritical: The result is exceptional. You have great or extreme effect.
SOD.RollFortuneSuccess: The result is good. You have standard or full effect.
SOD.RollFortunePartialSuccess: The result is mixed. You have limited or partial effect.
SOD.RollFortuneFailure: The result is bad. You have poor or little effect.
SOD.RollGatherInformationSuccess: Great: You get exceptional details. The information is complete and follow-up questions may expand into related areas or reveal more than you hoped for.
SOD.RollGatherInformationPartialSuccess: Standard: You get good details. Clarifying and follow-up questions are possible.
SOD.RollGatherInformationFailure: Limited: You get incomplete or partial information. More information gathering will be needed to get all the answers.
SOD.RollEngagementCritical: Exceptional result. You've already overcome the first obstacle and you're in a controlled position for what's next.
SOD.RollEngagementSuccess: Good result. You're in a controlled position when the action starts.
SOD.RollEngagementPartialSuccess: Mixed result. You're in a risky position when the action starts.
SOD.RollEngagementFailure: Bad result. You're in a desperate position when the action starts.
SOD.RollAcquireAssetResult: You gain an asset of Tier {tier_quality} quality.
